member.name: M:ChargifyDotNet.ChargifyConnect.#ctor(ChargifyDotNet.Configuration.IChargifyAccountConfig)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ChargifyConnect class using the specified account configuration.
member.remarks: This constructor simplifies initialization by allowing all required connection settings to be provided through a single configuration object. The values from the configuration are used to set up the connection to the Chargify service.
member.param: An object that provides the site, API key, API password, and shared key required to connect to the Chargify API. Cannot be null.

member.summary: Chargify allows you to record payments that occur outside of the normal flow of payment processing. These payments are considered external payments.A common case to apply such a payment is when a customer pays by check or some other means for their subscription.
member.param: The ID of the subscription to apply this manual payment record to
The decimal amount of the payment (ie. 10.00 for $10)
The memo to include with the manual payment
member.returns: The payment result, null otherwise.

member.name: M:ChargifyDotNet.ChargifyConnect.AddPayment(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Chargify allows you to record payments that occur outside of the normal flow of payment processing. These payments are considered external payments.A common case to apply such a payment is when a customer pays by check or some other means for their subscription.
member.param: The ID of the subscription to apply this manual payment record to
The amount in cents of the payment (ie. $10 would be 1000 cents)
The memo to include with the manual payment
member.returns: The payment result, null otherwise.

The decimal amount of the payment (ie. 10.00 for $10)

The amount (in cents only) like 100 is $1.00
A helpful explanation for the refund.
member.returns: The IRefund object indicating successful, or unsuccessful.

member.name: T:ChargifyDotNet.IComponent
member.summary: Components are a way to offer Customers a product that is billed on a per-usage basis.

member.name: P:ChargifyDotNet.IComponent.ID
member.summary: The ID for this component

member.name: P:ChargifyDotNet.IComponent.Quantity
member.summary: The amount of units used

member.name: P:ChargifyDotNet.IComponent.Memo
member.summary: An optional description for this component

member.name: T:ChargifyDotNet.ComponentUpgradeProrationScheme
member.summary: The scheme used if the proration was an upgrade. This is only present when the allocation was created mid-period.
member.remarks: The API uses hyphens for word seperation, I use underscores and replace the hyphens with underscores during parsing so I can parse the enumerated values

member.name: F:ChargifyDotNet.ComponentUpgradeProrationScheme.Prorate_Delay_Capture
member.summary: A charge is added for the prorated amount due, but the card is not charged until the subscriptions next renewal

member.name: F:ChargifyDotNet.ComponentUpgradeProrationScheme.Prorate_Attempt_Capture
member.summary: A charge is added and we attempt to charge the credit card on file. If it fails, the charge will be accrued until the next renewal.

member.name: F:ChargifyDotNet.ComponentUpgradeProrationScheme.No_Prorate
member.summary: No charge is added.

member.name: F:ChargifyDotNet.ComponentUpgradeProrationScheme.Full_Price_Attempt_Capture
member.summary: A charge is added for the full price of the component change, and we attempt to charge the credit card on file. If it fails, the charge will be accrued until the next renewal.

member.name: F:ChargifyDotNet.ComponentUpgradeProrationScheme.Full_Price_Delay_Capture
member.summary: A charge is added for the full price of the component change, but the card is not charged until the subscriptions next renewal.

member.name: F:ChargifyDotNet.ComponentUpgradeProrationScheme.Unknown
member.summary: No value (internal to this library)

member.name: T:ChargifyDotNet.ComponentDowngradeProrationScheme
member.summary: The scheme used if the proration was a downgrade. This is only present when the allocation was created mid-period.
member.remarks: The API uses hyphens for word seperation, I use underscores and replace the hyphens with underscores during parsing so I can parse the enumerated values

member.name: F:ChargifyDotNet.ComponentDowngradeProrationScheme.Prorate
member.summary: A credit is added for the amount owed.

member.name: F:ChargifyDotNet.ComponentDowngradeProrationScheme.No_Prorate
member.summary: No credit is added

member.name: F:ChargifyDotNet.ComponentDowngradeProrationScheme.Unknown
member.summary: No value (internal to this library)

member.name: T:ChargifyDotNet.IMetadata
member.summary: Chargify Metadata is used to add your own meaningful values to subscription or customer records. Metadata is associated to a customer or subscription, and corresponds to a Metafield. When creating a new metadata object for a given record, if the metafield is not present it will be created.
member.remarks: Metadata values are limited to 2kB in size. Additonally, there are limits on the number of unique "names" available per resource.

member.name: T:ChargifyDotNet.ISubscriptionCreateOptions
member.summary: The options that allow you to create a subscription. You must set at least a product (by ID or by handle) and a customer (by ID, by attributes or by reference value)

member.name: P:ChargifyDotNet.ISubscriptionCreateOptions.ProductHandle
member.summary: The API Handle of the product for which you are creating a subscription. Required, unless a product_id is given instead.

member.name: P:ChargifyDotNet.ISubscriptionCreateOptions.ProductID
member.summary: The Product ID of the product for which you are creating a subscription. The product ID is not currently published, so we recommend using the API Handle instead.

member.name: P:ChargifyDotNet.ISubscriptionCreateOptions.CustomerID
member.summary: The ID of an existing customer within Chargify. Required, unless a customer_reference or a set of customer_attributes is given.

member.name: P:ChargifyDotNet.ISubscriptionCreateOptions.CustomerReference
member.summary: The reference value (provided by your app) of an existing customer within Chargify. Required, unless a customer_id or a set of customer_attributes is given.

member.name: P:ChargifyDotNet.ISubscriptionCreateOptions.CustomerAttributes
member.summary: Details about the new customer

member.name: P:ChargifyDotNet.ISubscriptionCreateOptions.PaymentProfileID
member.summary: The Payment Profile ID of an existing card or bank account, which belongs to an existing customer to use for payment for this subscription

member.name: P:ChargifyDotNet.ISubscriptionCreateOptions.PaymentProfileAttributes
member.summary: Details of the payment profile to use with this new subscription

member.name: P:ChargifyDotNet.ISubscriptionCreateOptions.CreditCardAttributes
member.summary: Details of the credit card to use with this new subscription

member.name: P:ChargifyDotNet.ISubscriptionCreateOptions.CancellationMessage
member.summary: (Optional) Can be used when canceling a subscription (via the HTTP DELETE method) to make a note about the reason for cancellation.

member.name: P:ChargifyDotNet.ISubscriptionCreateOptions.NextBillingAt
member.summary: (Optional) Set this attribute to a future date/time to sync imported subscriptions to your existing renewal schedule.

member.name: P:ChargifyDotNet.ISubscriptionCreateOptions.ExpirationTracksNextBillingChange
member.summary: (Optional, default false) When set to true, and when next_billing_at is present, if the subscription expires, the expires_at will be shifted by the same amount of time as the difference between the old and new next billing dates.

member.name: P:ChargifyDotNet.ISubscriptionCreateOptions.VatNumber
member.summary: (Optional) Supplying the VAT number allows EU customers to opt-out of the Value Added Tax assuming the merchant address and customer billing address are not within the same EU country.

member.summary: (Optional) The coupon code of the coupon to apply

member.summary: (Optional) The coupon codes of the coupons to apply

member.summary: (Optional, used only for Delayed Product Change) When set to true, indicates that a changed value for product_handle should schedule the product change to the next subscription renewal.

member.name: T:ChargifyDotNet.ISubscriptionOverride
member.summary: Interface for properties that can be overridden at Chargify, in the context of a subscription.

member.name: P:ChargifyDotNet.ISubscriptionOverride.ActivatedAt
member.summary: Can be used to record an external signup date. Chargify uses this field to record when a subscription first goes active (either at signup or at trial end)

member.name: P:ChargifyDotNet.ISubscriptionOverride.CanceledAt
member.summary: Can be used to record an external cancellation date. Chargify sets this field automatically when a subscription is canceled, whether by request or via dunning.

member.name: P:ChargifyDotNet.ISubscriptionOverride.CancellationMessage
member.summary: Can be used to record a reason for the original cancellation.

member.name: P:ChargifyDotNet.ISubscriptionOverride.ExpiresAt
member.summary: Can be used to record an external expiration date. Chargify sets this field automatically when a subscription expires (ceases billing) after a prescribed amount of time.

member.name: T:ChargifyDotNet.Metadata
member.summary: Chargify Metadata is used to add your own meaningful values to subscription or customer records. Metadata is associated to a customer or subscription, and corresponds to a Metafield. When creating a new metadata object for a given record, if the metafield is not present it will be created.
member.remarks: Metadata values are limited to 2kB in size. Additonally, there are limits on the number of unique "names" available per resource.
